comments:

I set the debug trace to FINEST, but debug traces don't sho anything wrong. Then I thought that the server was not properly configured (may be an axis problem). I added the saaj.jar at front of the classpath, but nothing changes. 

In order to know if this is an axis problem, I just installed Axis on weblogic, and it is working fine. 

Moreover, when I just run the report, it woorks correctly: 
http://192.168.1.3:7001/Web%20Viewer%20Example/run?__report=test.rptdesign&sample=my+parameter

generates the report.

With some other reports, I get the winndow (with the toolbar), but the report is not displayed. Then I can click on buttons, but the dialog box outputs a SOAP error (user Error) (no error in logs). The "print" button, generating the PDF works fine.

In downloaded axis package, there are 2 jars: commons-logging-1.0.4.jar, log4j-1.2.8.jar. They also need to be copied into WEB-INF/lib as other 6 axis related jars.

This is true only for weblogic. For tomcat, jboss, websphere, they are not nececcsary.

Let us know the result.

Of course, my web-inf lib contains all required libraries,
log4j and common loggins (and logging is working fine because I have
the traces when changing the log level to FINEST). 

But I do not see anything about my error in the log files.

Moreover, every JAX/AXIS request returns:
   
 
 
  
  Exception in:
soapenv:Server.userException

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException 
 
 So I think that the problem is indeed a jar conflict, but because there is
no error traces (stacktrace) I don't know about which jar is the cause. 

 The problem happens with WebLogic server 8.1 SP5 (8.1 SP4 is working fine).

Our testing env is 8.1 sp1. It works fine. We need to spend some time investigate this later. Tentatively move this to 2.1. 

Pascal,

Is this change fine with you?
Also, try to remove these 2 logging jars if necessary. When we test this with other app server, these logging jars are the reason for the jar conflicts.

Pascal,

Also, please try 8.1 sp6 if possible.

Hi all, thanks for your replies.

-> I try to remove the two jars, and nothing better.
-> WL 8.1 SP6 : I do not have it (and not available on bea.com) 
and in fact i am using wl 8.1 integration (with business process int)

-> For my point of view, I can wait. Indeed, I am just evaluating the product. I am currently working on a large project based on WLI 8.1 SP5, and we need a 
reporting module. At last, BIRT can fit our needs because the PDF report generation is working perfectly. I just was disapointed about the interractive functionnality (HTML page), but I do not have the time to get all the sources and to debug the whole stuff.

Thanks,

Pascal
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 124085 ***

This is not a duplicate bug: not the same product.

Weblogic 8.1 SP5 server is not Weblogic 8.1 SP5 Platform

Indeed, Platform is based on 8-server 8.1SP5 with many more tools, jars,
package etc. What I can say is that I tested Birt on WL8.1 SP5 Server and it is working perfectly. The problems occurs only when you are creating a Platoform or Integration Domain with WLI. There the first page is buggy and there are many other errors. This should be a class loader problem. I opened a case at BEA but I don't know if they will fix / investigate it. In the meantime, if BIRT team is able to test it on WLI....

So I propose to reopen the bug because this is not a duplicate.
